history.content:
not sure why you are only asking about "8 week" internships -- internship duration largely depends on the company, and most of the time they'll accommodate your schedule (i.e. if you need to end before a certain date). 8 weeks is also arguably a very short time -- most internships are 10-12.

anyway, this depends on maaany different factors. it depends on who you know, who you meet, what year you are, etc... that being said, by sophomore year it's fairly reasonable to expect a summer internship if you put in the effort to find one. that means going out to career fairs, applying on company websites, cold emailing... i probably put in ~50 applications my sophomore year and got around 6 interviews. 

in the end it's all a lottery. you could just be incredibly unlucky and no recruiter gets to your resume in their stack. you never know. the only thing you can do is maximize your chances by putting yourself out there as much as possible and practicing with interview questions. cracking the coding is the industry go-to SWE interview guide, i'd suggest you take a look at that

How likely is it to find an 8 week internship in the winter or summer for tech? Have you/someone you know been able to find one? Thanks!

EDIT: 8 weeks specifically because due to study abroad my schedule's shifted, and I know most companies typically only do 10 - 12 weeks.
history.subject: 8 week tech internships

history.content: How likely is it to find an 8 week internship in the winter or summer for tech? Have you/someone you know been able to find one? Thanks!
